content.question: Water is transported from the soil into the roots of a plant, and then up the stem to the leaves. A student determines that the water potential of root cells in the plant is <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>. Which of the following claims is best supported by this measurement?

choices.label: The water potential of the soil will be higher than <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>, whereas the water potential of the leaf will be lower than <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>.

The water potential of the soil will be lower than <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>, whereas the water potential of the leaf will be higher than <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>.

The water potential of both the soil and the leaf will be higher than <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>.

The water potential of both the soil and the leaf will be equal to <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>.

content.answer: The water potential of the soil will be higher than <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>, whereas the water potential of the leaf will be lower than <math alttext="negative 0.2 megapascal" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>MPa</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace></mspace></math>.
